intro: Tabernaemontana gracilis, commonly known as the slender star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has strap-like, narrow leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
